definitions: The moonwalk is a dance move in which the dancer moves backwards while seemingly walking forwards.
Formerly known as the 'backslide', the moonwalk is a popping move.
It became popular around the world following Michael Jackson's moonwalk during the performance of 'Billie Jean' on Motown 25: Yesterday, Today, Forever, which was broadcast on May 16, 1983.
Jackson has been credited as renaming the 'backslide' to the moonwalk and it became his signature move.
